sentences.sentence: The Prince( 王子 ) thanked him, took the wand( 魔杖 ) and the bread, and set out on his way.
When he arrived, everything was as the dwarf( 小矮人 ) had said.
The door sprang open at the third stroke( 撞击 ) of the wand, and when he had given the lions the bread, he entered the castle( 城堡 ).
He came to a large and splendid( 华丽的 ) hall, in which sat some enchanted( 中了魔法的 ) princes, who seemed to have slept for a long, long time.
A sword( 剑 ) and a loaf( 条 ) of bread were lying there, which he carried away.
After this, he entered a bedroom( 卧室 ), in which was a beautiful girl.
The girl was very happy to see him, kissed him, and told him that he had saved her, and should have the whole of her kingdom.
She said that if he would return in a year, then they could get married.
She also told him where the Water of Life was, and told him to hurry and take some of it before the clock struck twelve.
Then he kept going, and at last came to a room where there was a beautiful soft bed, and as he was very tired, he wanted to rest a little. So he lay down and fell asleep.

When he woke up, the clock was striking a quarter to twelve( 十一点四十五分 )
.
He got up quickly, ran to the spring, got some water using a nearby cup, and hurried away.
But just as he was passing through the iron door, the clock struck twelve, and the iron door fell so quickly and heavily that it cut off a piece of his heel( 脚跟 ).
But he was very happy to have found the Water of Life, and headed for home again.

He again passed the dwarf, and when the dwarf saw the sword and the loaf, he said, “With these you can gain( 获得 ) great wealth. With the sword you can kill whole armies, and the bread will never come to an end.”
But the prince would not go home to his father without his brothers, and said, “Dear dwarf, do you know where my two brothers are?
They went out before I did in search of the Water of Life, and have not returned.”
“They are caught between two mountains,” said the dwarf.
“I have condemned( 惩罚 ) them to stay there, because they were so proud and arrogant( 自大的 ).”
Then the Prince begged( 乞求 ) until the dwarf finally freed them.
But the dwarf warned him, saying, “Beware( 当心 ) of them, for they have bad hearts.”
When his brothers came, he was happy, and told them how he had found the Water of Life and had brought a cup of it away with him,
and had rescued( 解救 ) a beautiful princess, who was willing to wait a year for him,
and then their wedding( 婚礼 ) was to be celebrated and he would have a great kingdom.
After that they rode on together, and came to a country suffering( 遭受 ) from war and great hunger.
Then the Prince went to the King of that country and gave him the loaf.
The King used it to feed( 为...提供食物 ) and satisfy the whole of his kingdom.
Then the Prince gave him the sword also, and the King used to kill all his enemies, and could now live in rest and peace.
The Prince then took back his loaf and his sword, and the three brothers rode on.
But after this they came to two more countries suffering from war and famine( 饥饿 ), and each time the prince gave his loaf and his sword to the Kings, and had now saved three kingdoms.
After that they went on board a ship and sailed( 航行 ) over the sea.
During the voyage( 航行 ), the two elder brothers talked privately and said, “The youngest has found the Water of Life, and so our father will give him the kingdom that should have gone to us.”
They then began to seek( 谋求 ) revenge( 报复 ), and plotted( 秘密计划 ) with each other to destroy( 毁掉 ) him.
They waited until he was fast asleep, and then they poured( 倒掉 ) the Water of Life into another cup, and took it for themselves.
But into the youngest son’s cup they poured salt sea water.
When they arrived home, the youngest took his cup to the sick King in order that he might drink out of it, and be cured( 被治愈 ).
But when had he drunk a very little of the salt sea water, he became still worse than before.
Then the two elder brothers came, and said that the youngest had tried to poison( 毒害 ) him.
They said that they had brought him the true Water of Life, and handed it to him.
As soon as he tasted it, his sickness left him, and he became as strong and healthy as in the days of his youth.

article_info.previous: 国王病重，三个王子在花园商议办法，这时一个老者走过来告诉他们生命之水可以救国王。三个王子依次上路去找生命之水，大王子和二王子因为傲慢无礼，被小矮人困住了；王子因为礼貌得体，得到了小矮人的帮助。
article_info.share_words: The door sprang open at the third stroke of the wand, and when he had given the lions the bread, he entered the castle.

question.cn: 王子毫发无伤地取到了生命之水吗？
question.en: Did the Prince get the Water of Life unhurt?

analysis: 文中提到：“But just as he was passing through the iron door, the clock struck twelve, and the iron door fell so quickly and heavily that it cut off a piece of his heel.”王子的脚跟受伤了，因此答案选B。

question.cn: 小矮人对两个无礼的王子做了什么？
question.en: What did the dwarf do to the two rude princes?

options.en: He made them trapped between the mountains.

analysis: 文中提到：“They are caught between two mountains,” said the dwarf. “I have condemned them to stay there, because they were so proud and arrogant.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 两个无礼的王子获救后对小王子做了什么？
question.en: What did the two rude princes do to the third after they were saved?

options.cn: 他们把小王子扔到了海里。
options.en: They threw him into the sea.

options.cn: 他们寻求报复，密谋毁掉小王子。
options.en: They sought revenge and plotted to destroy him.

analysis: 文中提到：“They then began to seek revenge, and plotted with each other to destroy him. They waited until he was fast asleep, and then they poured the Water of Life into another cup, and took it for themselves. But into the youngest son’s cup they poured salt sea water.”两位王子得救后恩将仇报，因此答案选C。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第96天
